issue.title: Add a collections page
issue.body: I'd like to be able to see in one place all the inscriptions which are using genetic provenance. "collections" might not be the right word, but something like `/collections`, where all collections are shown, in order of how recently a child was added to the collection.

comment.body:
> Probably a good idea to paginate the children on inscription page too, otherwise it'll try to load all the children on the same page. Maybe, the children list could be capped at 10 along with a link to this new collections page.

Yep, and that is exactly a problem I encountered 

`curl --location --request GET 'http://<testnet>/inscription/4728a9610731cc4ddcc7285d3c52aa535ba73ca4400b34d002bce703612e3c68i0' --header 'Accept: application/json'`

`http://<testnet>/inscription/4728a9610731cc4ddcc7285d3c52aa535ba73ca4400b34d002bce703612e3c68i0`

This collection has over 2000+ children and page takes forever to load just like JSON API

issue.title: Features/brotlimagick
issue.body:
1. it brotlifies text encoded messages, so long as they are more than 10 chars (as brotli doesn't do anything at all for small strings anyways)
2. the server shows brotlified messages
3. the tests run
4. it uses a new content-encoding header, tag 8
![Screenshot from 2023-10-25 18-21-40](https://github.com/ordinals/ord/assets/22843601/c4ddfab4-9c68-4825-8d9b-a7a8097369c4)
http://localhost/preview/b882ff711cfb777e491d89aa13effe51a45f952189df85e2db821c1746677289i0 (testnet)

comment.body:
Just noticed that the PR has the server serving decompressed content. IMO, the server should to be serving compressed content with the appropriate `Content-encoding` header based on the accept encoding header. If the request doesn't have a compatible accept encoding header, then the server can send a decompressed response.

This approach would provide a pretty significant speed/performance boost as well.

issue.title: Bug <> Database already open. Cannot acquire lock
issue.body:
Command: 

Running Server with the command

```
./target/release/ord --rpc-url http://127.0.0.1:18443 --bitcoin-rpc-pass rpcpassword --bitcoin-rpc-user rpcuser --regtest server
```

Trying to get wallet balance with the command
```
 ./target/release/ord --rpc-url http://127.0.0.1:18443 --bitcoin-rpc-pass rpcpassword --bitcoin-rpc-user rpcuser --regtest --wallet Charlie wallet balance
```

Error: 
```
Index file "/Users/nakul/Library/Application Support/ord/regtest/index.redb" needs recovery. This can take a long time, especially for the --index-sats index.
error 1 : Database already open. Cannot acquire lock.
```

I get the client is running in the background that's what causing the issue. Is there a way to fix it?

comment.body:
> > That index.redb is quite weak and very easily to either be locked or corrupted.
> 
> 
> 
> Yeah I nuke my regtest folder all the time its nbd always have a terminal open for it haha. 

Is there any way to make it stronger or using different structure of index so we user don't suffer it from time to time 🎃🎃🎃

pull_request.title: Update docs with new position of --enable-json-api

issue.title: Inscription IDs are Potentially Unstable
issue.body:
The changes in 7e6eb73b5212f3b6647785cba7bc001b4ed7c604 (PR #2145) create the potential for instability of inscription Ids.

Specifically, prior to this commit all values were i0 due to it being 'txid.into()' (where the conversion populated a 0 automatically if not provided). The change makes it the index within the parsed envelopes. This would be fine, except that it relies on the envelopes that are parsed being stable between versions (and more importantly between services). While this is the ideal, it recreates the instability that led to the confusion about inscription numbers.

We can keep this id for backwards compatibility (as it is reliable if we assume that all envelopes are parsed equally by two parties and no one has triggered any of the very specific edgecases), but we should further define an id that uses only on-chain data that doesn't require indexing anything other than the specific envelope that an id references.

While we should explore other options, my kneejerk reaction would be defining identifiers such that they point to the transaction (using txid like we already do) and then further define the location of the envelope within the transaction. This could be done using (vIn, offsetWithinTapscript) or offsetWithinRawTransaction.


The gut reaction of most developers will be to assume this doesn't matter as the ids are stable for any given version, but the purpose of a stable identifier goes beyond individual versions and MUST be stable between versions to be useful (or when we share and use them we would also need to include which version they correspond with).

comment.body: there are a lot of sat serial number IDs floating around unused in TXs. maybe use them? not onchain but def stable.

issue.title: Bug <> Database already open. Cannot acquire lock
issue.body:
Command: 

Running Server with the command

```
./target/release/ord --rpc-url http://127.0.0.1:18443 --bitcoin-rpc-pass rpcpassword --bitcoin-rpc-user rpcuser --regtest server
```

Trying to get wallet balance with the command
```
 ./target/release/ord --rpc-url http://127.0.0.1:18443 --bitcoin-rpc-pass rpcpassword --bitcoin-rpc-user rpcuser --regtest --wallet Charlie wallet balance
```

Error: 
```
Index file "/Users/nakul/Library/Application Support/ord/regtest/index.redb" needs recovery. This can take a long time, especially for the --index-sats index.
error 1 : Database already open. Cannot acquire lock.
```

I get the client is running in the background that's what causing the issue. Is there a way to fix it?

comment.body:
> Yeah you can only have one instance in the index at a time. 
> 
> > My regtest blocks are already synced by the server shouldn't it release the RW lock so that it can be used by different services?
> 
> 
> 
> Are you sure your shutting down the process correctly maybe its hanging. On mac its `Command-C` and windows `Control-C` if your running the server and want to check balance you need to gracefully shut down the ord server first. 
> 
> 
> 
> > Created the inscription and mined in regtest.
> 
> Deleted the index.redb.
> 
> Restarted the server to regenerate index.redb.
> 
> 
> 
> You shouldn't have to keep deleting the index unless its an incompatible ord version your switching between. 
> 
> 

Last time I have tried everything and doesn't work without downloading a new index file 🤤 

That index.redb is quite weak and very easily to either be locked or corrupted.

issue.title: Should --enable-json-API be passed to server instead of on the top level?
Bug <> Database already open. Cannot acquire lock
issue.body:
Command: 

Running Server with the command

```
./target/release/ord --rpc-url http://127.0.0.1:18443 --bitcoin-rpc-pass rpcpassword --bitcoin-rpc-user rpcuser --regtest server
```

Trying to get wallet balance with the command
```
 ./target/release/ord --rpc-url http://127.0.0.1:18443 --bitcoin-rpc-pass rpcpassword --bitcoin-rpc-user rpcuser --regtest --wallet Charlie wallet balance
```

Error: 
```
Index file "/Users/nakul/Library/Application Support/ord/regtest/index.redb" needs recovery. This can take a long time, especially for the --index-sats index.
error 1 : Database already open. Cannot acquire lock.
```

I get the client is running in the background that's what causing the issue. Is there a way to fix it?

comment.body:
Yeah you can only have one instance in the index at a time. 
> My regtest blocks are already synced by the server shouldn't it release the RW lock so that it can be used by different services?

Are you sure your shutting down the process correctly maybe its hanging. On mac its `Command-C` and windows `Control-C` if your running the server and want to check balance you need to gracefully shut down the ord server first. 

> Created the inscription and mined in regtest.
Deleted the index.redb.
Restarted the server to regenerate index.redb.

You shouldn't have to keep deleting the index unless its an incompatible ord version your switching between.

issue.title: Features/brotlimagick
issue.body:
1. it brotlifies text encoded messages, so long as they are more than 10 chars (as brotli doesn't do anything at all for small strings anyways)
2. the server shows brotlified messages
3. the tests run
4. it uses a new content-encoding header, tag 8
![Screenshot from 2023-10-25 18-21-40](https://github.com/ordinals/ord/assets/22843601/c4ddfab4-9c68-4825-8d9b-a7a8097369c4)
http://localhost/preview/b882ff711cfb777e491d89aa13effe51a45f952189df85e2db821c1746677289i0 (testnet)

comment.body: @elocremarc Just setting the `Content-Encoding` header and serving compressed content should be sufficient for the browser to automatically decompress.

issue.title: Save state of batch in state.yaml
issue.body:
This was a feature that didn't get included in the original batch PR. It would be nice to output the inscriptionId as well as the filename from the yaml. This would be helpful for referencing layers that were inscribed in a batch and using them in subsequent inscriptions.
https://github.com/ordinals/ord/pull/2504

comment.body: This is also good, probably easier to to than the `reinscribe` thing. I would start by just writing the normal output of the inscribe command to a json file (since it is json). Next step you could write it to yaml which should also be quite easy with serde.

issue.title: Reinscribe Batch
issue.body: Now that we have batch inscriptions. It would be nice to also have the ability to do batch inscriptions onto the same sat.

comment.body: It would add a new mode called `reinscribe`. If a parent is present all inscriptions would point to the parent sat/inscription and if not they would all just be reinscribed onto the first sat in the output

issue.title: Save state of batch in state.yaml
issue.body:
This was a feature that didn't get included in the original batch PR. It would be nice to output the inscriptionId as well as the filename from the yaml. This would be helpful for referencing layers that were inscribed in a batch and using them in subsequent inscriptions.
https://github.com/ordinals/ord/pull/2504

issue.title: Provide a way to burn an inscription
issue.body:
Ord client should provide an official way to burn an inscription. This way, a parent inscription can be burned after creating a collection, and we can show a "burned" label on the new collection page #2561.

cc @veryordinally

comment.body: I think burning to an unspendable output would be ideal. Then you can still sign for the inscription. It would allow for POAPs and Soul Bound Tokens.

pull_request.title: Refactor rune assertions
pull_request.body: This is a little more compact, and because the balances and runes are both sorted before comparison, it won't be insensitive to txids reordering, which happens when the runestone changes.
